runs.comm: starts off with spin, on the pads and clipped to the leg side
tossed up and he gets forward and defends this one
slammed down the ground! Tossed up and he stayed at the crease and Stirling lofts it wide of mid-on
drifting on the pads and clipped just wide of short fine leg
tossed up on the pads and worked away to midwicket
slower through the air, plays too early and he gets an inside edge on the drive
tossed up on the pads and he works it away down to deep square leg
fullish outside off and he drives him down to cover
that was cheeky! The switch hit this time, he was in position early, Kamungozi pitched it on middle and leg, in the slot, slapped over point
fullish on the pads and driven down to long-on
he stays beside the line and punches it to deep point
he flicks this to midwicket for a single
he gets away with a wide one, Porterfield ends up mistiming the drive down the track
clipped away behind square on the on side and they do well to take the first run quickly, good running
holds back on the punch and ends up stabbing at it, plays it to cover
slower ball and he dabs it down to short third man
he comes down the track and slams it down the ground to long-on
he goes back at the crease and defends back to the bowler
tossed up and Porterfield made room and freed his arms and lofted it down to long-off
makes room and drills a full delivery down to long-off
this was pushed through quicker and he looked to sweep and was struck on the pads but outside the line of the stumps
he gets forward and drills it down to long-off
a clean hit indeed! Utseya gives it more air and Porterfield was down on his knee early for the slog, middled it and it sailed over deep midwicket
stopped on him and he gets an outside edge
good attempt by Williams at the boundary, this was dropped short and he pulls wide of square leg, Williams sprinted to his right and got a hand to it but the ball rolled towards the rope
fuller delivery and he chipped it down to deep square leg, Williams in business again
wide and angling across and he punches it to mid-off, fumble but it doesn't cost a run
a bit straight and he pushes it to the on side
bowls the off cutter, too early on the shot and he was too early on the shot
he drifts down the leg side and wide called
always dangerous drifting to the leg side with the fine leg up, Porterfield did well to adjust the pull and place it with soft hands wide of short fine
no respect to the new bowler, Stirling makes room early, it was a length ball and Stirling did well to adjust and place it wide of backward point, top shot
treating him like a spinner by dancing down the wicket again, picks another length ball and chips it over midwicket
gets worse for Panyangara! The keeper is up and he bowls a low full toss down the leg side, Stirling gets a little bat on it and it was enough
4 in a row! He bowls a fuller one outside off and Stirling reaches out and gets an outside edge, keeper's up, no slips, straight to the third man rope
good comeback there, fires the yorker and he can only dig it out
chipped down to deep midwicket, Ireland have raced to 61 in the Powerplay
Comes round the wicket, Porterfield makes room and chips this one just wide of cover
did well to toss it up and Stirling was down the track and mistimed it back to the bowler
down the track and plays it square to the off side
lost control of that and really wide down the leg side
stays back at the crease and punches that hard down to long-off
down the track and checks the shot
he drops the ball short and he pulls him hard down to deep square leg
bowls the slower ball, the cutter, Porterfield stays back, waits for it and cuts to the sweeper
he makes a bit of room and punches it to cover
good placement there, this was tossed up outside off, Stirling made room, went for the drive and the outside edge bisected point and short third man
goes the other side this time! Tossed up on middle and leg and he gets on his knee and sweeps him to deep square leg
tucks it away wide of midwicket and Porterfield takes the first one hard, Stirling has to hurry for the second
tries to nudge that down to third man and Kamungozi charges from short third man and manages to cut it off
drops it short and he pulls him to deep midwicket
some relief for Zimbabwe! Tossed up on middle and leg, Porterfield goes for the slog, miscues it and Maruma takes the catch running forward from deep midwicket
he stays back at the crease and clips it to midwicket
slower through the air and down the leg side, swept towards short fine leg
if you drop it short here you're asking for trouble, he read the length quickly, went back and bludgeoned it over deep midwicket
on the pads and clipped away to the on side
finds the gap at cover, tossed up outside off and he makes room and drives on the up wide of cover, nobody in the deep to cut that off
tossed up and he takes a single to long-off
slower through the air and he checks his drive
he drops it a bit too short and he rocks back and cuts just wide of short third man
he goes back at the crease and cuts just wide of point
close call for Joyce as the ball skids through, he defends and the ball rolls close to the stumps
swivels and pulls a length ball down to square leg

Raza takes the skier and it was well judged! Stirling falls to a poor shot, he was looking to slam that straight down the ground, didn't get to the pitch of it and it was miles up in the air, Raza gets under it near the region of mid-on and hangs on to it on the fall
length ball outside off and he knocks it to the off side
this was short and wide and he wasn't afraid to give that a dab to third man despite a slip in place
this was a slower ball angling across and he pushes it softly down to cover
drifts on the pads and he nudges it to the on side
tossed up and he gives him the charge and lofts down to deep midwicket, unfortunately the throw hits the umpire, Steve Davis takes a blow on the shoulder
finds the gap with ease, tossed up and he gets on his knee and sweeps with force and finds the big gap at deep square leg
drops it a bit too short and he clips it to the on side
a bit too short again and he rocks back and cuts to the off side
Poynter stays back and cuts straight to cover
he stays back and punches it down to deep point
fullish on the pads and drilled down the ground to long-on
this was short and wide outside off and he stays back and crashes it wide of backward point, punishes a poor
fullish outside off and he pushes it down to long-off
fullish in length outside off and he drives him down to deep cover
that was a slower leg cutter, too slow onto the batsman, chopped back to the bowler
this was full and wide outside off and he drives him down to deep cover
fullish outside off and driven down to long-on
good length outside off and pushes it to the off side
this was dragged too short on middle and leg, he rocks back and punishes the length, biffed to deep midwicket
that was dragged too full and wide outside off, chases it but fails to get any bat on it
beaten on the drive, this was the offcutter, too close to cut and he nearly edges it
this was bowled fuller and he jams it out to the off side

There's an appeal for a catch at midwicket but it could be a bump ball. This was full and swinging in, Poynter looked to flick it away and it went low to Chigumbura who took the catch cleanly falling forward, no doubts there, the question was if the ball bounced once after it made contact with the bat, replays confirmed that the ball ballooned off the bottom of the bat so it's fair
this one too swung and he pushes at it and is beaten

are we in for a twist here? Clever captaincy here getting in a slip, this was a length ball outside off and Wilson chased it, thick outside edge and Masakadza showed good reflexes to take it to his left, that went quickly off the bat
tossed up and he makes room and cuts to deep cover
he drifts down the leg side and wide called
walks across the crease for a premeditated paddle down to fine leg
he comes down the track and works it down to long-on
flatter one and he pushes him down to long-on
drops it a bit too short and he cuts him wide of point
comes down the track and drives him down to long-on
almost a run out! Down the track and the ball drops to the off side, they hesitate and take the run, Joyce had to dive and the throw was wide
full and clipped towards midwicket
he makes room and punches it straight to cover, can't find the gap
drifts on the pads and he nudges it off the pads
well bowled, fired that flat and he could only punch it down the track
he gives him room and he smashes that wide of cover and Raza dives at  deep cover, fumbles but recovers

beats deep midwicket! What a way to start the over, this was bowled short of a length, O'Brien stays at the crease and pulls in front of square, had the height and the distance was just enough to clear the rope
10 off 2! This was pitched up outside off and he stays at the crease and lofts him over mid-off, he knew the fielder was up, safe shot
he goes airborne again, pitched up on the pads and chipped down to long-on, one bounce to the fielder
he gets forward and takes a single to mid-off
the bowler was unlucky there! This was full and swinging in and O'Brien gives that a heave, gets an inside edge that beats the keeper and short fine leg
after the assault the bowler gets his wicket! Funny old over, this was pitched up and he stayed at the crease and lofted it down to long-off, the fielder was pushed back
gets forward and punches it wide of cover
full on the stumps and driven down to cover
slower ball wide outside off, the off cutter and Thompson swings and misses
slower ball shorter outside off and he punches it wide of point, they scramble the single, the throe was wide
another short slower ball, looked ungainly as Joyce pulled that to square leg
that ends a decent over, this was skidded on the pads and the batsman wasn't quick enough on the shot, hits the pads and rolls away
pitched up on the pads and Joyce flicks this one over midwicket, fumble by Raza but only a single
this was full and wide and he makes room and almost pierces the gap at mid-off, they take a single

and a magnificent inswinging yorker from Panyangara makes things interesting again! Joyce made a bit of room and exposed his stumps, he failed to get his bat down to dig it out, the ball just kissed the leg stump and knocked down the leg bail

and we have a run out in the middle of all this would you believe this! Sorensen digs out a yorker to mid-off and risks the single, the throw from Williams was accurate and Sorensen was miles short, he collided with the bowler but Panyanagara wasn't complaining
it's a low full toss and he makes room and gets an outside edge to third man, good sliding stop restricts it to a single

they scramble through with a bye and Taylor fails to hit the target! Alex Cusack tries to force away a yorker outside off, he missed and so did Taylor with his under-arm throw to the striker's end, Thompson collided with a fielder as he completed the bye and by then Cusack was safe at the other end
